org.cougaar.mts.base
Interface MessageReader

All Known Implementing Classes:
MessageReaderDelegateImplBase, MessageReaderImpl
public interface MessageReader

This is the first station in the receiver for serializling LinkProtocols. MessageWriter and MessageReader allow aspect authors to examine and filter the serialized data stream.

Aspect implementers must either call the package-access addFilter AttribuedMessage method or use pushValue("Filter", className) to get the MessageWriter and MessageReader delegates to be attached. Each message has the aspect chain built for it and the target's aspect chain is governed by the list as given by the sender. Normally the attribute is added in the DestinationLink's forwardMessage or addAttributes method.

The previous stop is MessageWriter on the sending side. The next stop is MessageDeliverer.

See Also:
AttributedMessage.addFilter(Object), Attributes#pushValue(String, Object), SendLink, SendQueue, Router, DestinationQueue, DestinationLink, MessageWriter, MessageDeliverer, Javadoc contributions from George Mount.

Method Detail

finalizeAttributes

void finalizeAttributes(AttributedMessage msg)
Called during deserialization of an AttributedMessage after the message attributes have been read. Gives the MessageReader the opportunity to view and modify the message attributes.

Parameters:
msg - The message for which this MessageReader is designated.
See Also:
preProcess()

preProcess

void preProcess()
Called by AttributedMessage during deserialization before getObjectInputStream and after finalizeAttributes.

See Also:
finalizeAttributes(AttributedMessage), getObjectInputStream(ObjectInput)

getObjectInputStream

java.io.InputStream getObjectInputStream(java.io.ObjectInput in)
                                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                                java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Called by AttributedMessage during deserialization. The stream is used to read the serialized message body. The returned InputStream is usually a filtered stream that modifies the contents as they are being read.

Parameters:
in - The next innermost stream in the nesting.
Returns:
An InputStream to be used for serialization of the message.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
See Also:
preProcess(), finishInput()

finishInput

void finishInput()
                 throws java.io.IOException
Called during AttributedMessage deserialization after the message body has been read.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - The stream could be cached so an IOException can be thrown here.
See Also:
getObjectInputStream(ObjectInput)

postProcess

void postProcess()
Called after finishInput in the AttributedMessage deserialization.
